functions.tag: {pages:['{"text":"Entry 1\\n-------------------\\nThe last thing I remember before waking up in this god-forsaken place was a sword in my gut. I guess that would mean this is what happens after death...\\nI don\'t have much paper, so I suppose I should only write what is necessary."}','{"text":"Entry 2:\\n-------------------\\nThere\'s no sun here so it\'s hard to keep track of time, but it feels like it\'s been weeks. I\'ve discovered that I can use the purple shrines with glowstone to return to the same location after death. This is important for any chance of escape."}','{"text":"This place is nothing if not desolate, but I hold firmly to hope regardless. If there\'s even the slightest possibility that I can see my husband and my daughter Emily again, then there\'s nothing that can get in my way... even those wretched skeletons..."}','{"text":"Entry 3:\\n-------------------\\nI think it\'s been about a year now. I nearly vomit at the taste of kelp, but other than that, I have no further updates.\\n\\nEntry 4:\\n-------------------\\nI miss you E... I still hope to see the woman you\'ve grown into.\\n "}','{"text":"Entry 5:\\n-------------------\\nI can\'t be totally sure, but I\'m almost positive I\'ve spent as much time in here as I spent in the before world. Or perhaps it\'s been much much longer. I\'ve noticed my vocabulary start to get worse. Maybe I should try talking to myself more to not lose it."}','{"text":"Entry 6:\\n-------------------\\nI\'ve seen evidence of others here but never any other people... maybe I\'ll find her here one day.\\n\\nEntry 7:\\n-------------------\\nI thought an afterlife would convince me god was real. It has done the opposite."}','{"text":"Entry 8:\\n-------------------\\nno more pages. last two. no more skin. only dark bones. finally means real nothing I hope. no more words in head. only kill and survive. i read this book much to remeber. i wish i writed more when i came. I wish I lived more in the before..."}','{"text":"i don\'t remember the before anymore. only words from this book. \\n\\ni think \\"sun\\" was good.\\n\\n\\"sword\\" was bad. \\n\\n\\"husband\\" some bad, mostly good.\\n\\n\\n\\"Emily\\" only good..."}'],title:"An Old Journal",author:"Clay Acaster",generation:3}

{pages:['{"text":"Entry 1\\n-------------------\\nThe last thing I remember before waking up in this god-forsaken place was a sword in my gut. I guess that would mean this is what happens after death...\\nI don\'t have much paper, so I suppose I should only write what is necessary."}','{"text":"Entry 2:\\n-------------------\\nThere\'s no sun here so it\'s hard to keep track of time, but it feels like it\'s been weeks. I\'ve discovered that I can use the purple shrines with glowstone to return to the same location after death. This is important for any chance of escape."}','{"text":"This place is nothing if not desolate, but I hold firmly to hope regardless. I still hope to see the woman you\'ve grown into.\\n "}','{"text":"Entry 5:\\n-------------------\\nI can\'t be totally sure, but I\'m almost positive I\'ve spent as much time in here as I spent in the before world. Or perhaps it\'s been much much longer. I\'ve noticed my vocabulary start to get worse. Maybe I should try talking to myself more to not lose it."}','{"text":"Entry 6:\\n-------------------\\nI\'ve seen evidence of others here but never any other people... maybe I\'ll find her here one day.\\n\\nEntry 7:\\n-------------------\\nI thought an afterlife would convince me god was real. I wish I lived more in the before..."}','{"text":"i don\'t remember the before anymore. only words from this book. \\n\\ni think \\"sun\\" was good.\\n\\n\\"sword\\" was bad. \\n\\n\\"husband\\" some bad, mostly good.\\n\\n\\n\\"Emily\\" only good..."}'],title:"An Old Journal",author:"Clay Acaster",generation:3}
